tourName: Exciting Cuba family holiday, for all ages
placesVisited: Havana, Vinales, Las Terrazas, Playa Larga, Trinidad, Escambray Mountains, Topes de Collante Nature Reserve, Cayo Iguana, Santa Clara, Cayo Santa Maria, Optional activities include: snorkelling, 4x4 truck rides, horse riding, canopy walkways, mountain hikes and zip lining
generalInfo:
As the largest island in the Caribbean, Cuba boasts no end of tropical idylls from where to kick start an exciting family holiday with limestone rock formations, forest covered mountain slopes and a fascinating historical back story providing a great choice of things to do, for all ages.

From peeling pastel paintwork on grand colonial properties to peaceful piazzas from where you can sit and watch the world salsa by, Cuba conjures a charmingly cultural vision of the past with giant classic cars and tiny family run lodgings offering just a couple of reasons for families to get excited.

Although modern Cuba, Havana in particular, is heading to the top of the list for culture seeking holiday makers there are still plenty of authentic, lesser-known, experiences for families to get their teeth into with waterfalls, steam trains and plantation tours adding to a varied and flexible itinerary.

Some of the hill top towns are just so fascinating with chances to go hiking in the Escambray Mountains or snorkelling around Cayo Iguana, near Trinidad, adding to a full choice for all ages to ensure this is one family holiday that ticks all the right boxes.

Cubans love kids and families will always receive a truly hospitable welcome from local people, especially if you’ve got plans to stay overnight in one of the traditional casas that create the perfect introduction to local life both for children and adults alike.

Optional outdoor activities come thick and fast on this two week tailor made tour with horse riding, underground boat rides, ziplines and rainforest walk ways all offering a superb chance for families to get to grips with some of Cuba’s best loved natural landscapes.

From bat-filled caves, teethed with stalactites and stalagmites, to beautiful beaches from where to swim, play or swing in a hammock, Cuba is a fantastic location for families looking to make the most of life outdoors with a tailor made itinerary the best way to include exciting adventures for all.

dayInfo.description: HAVANA Once you arrive at Havana airport where you will be met by our representative and taken to your hotel. The rest of the day is free for you to unwind or discover the city. Havana is best explored on foot, the old colonial centre has been immaculately restored and bejewelled with hidden hot spots amongst it's streets and alleyways. Sip coffee or dance the rumba at some of Havana's best cafes, bars and restaurants.

HAVANA Hop into a classic car for a guided tour of Havana passing by all of the main attractions. Once you reach the old streets, continue your journey on foot to discover the historic wonders of this vibrant city. The afternoon is free for you to pick up souvenirs, unwind or get lost in the city's finest foodie haunts.

HAVANA - VINALES After breakfast you will head out into the countryside to the wonderful town of Vinales. Fields of tobacco stretch across the red-earth plains, broken up by steep sided limestone outcrops and palm trees. Spot the small villages embedded in the landscape that are home to tobacco farmers, if you are lucky you may see them at work, preparing the land with ox drawn ploughs. The rest of the day is free for you to explore with your own personal guide.

VINALES Continue your tour of Cuba by horse and cart; exploring the the countries hidden valleys via peaceful winding tracks. Meet a tobacco farmer where you will see crop standing like soldiers in their fields and harvested leaves hung up for drying (depending on the time of year). Finish your day with a lesson in the art of rolling a traditional cuban cigar.

VINALES A full free day to explore Vinales – a driver and vehicle shall be available for you to use at your disposal. Spend time wandering around the charming town with its candy coloured buildings. Or, why not make use of the hop-on/hop-off bus to see some of the tourist hotspots, or spot hummingbirds in the tranquil botanical gardens. For children who are feeling adventurous why not try your hand as a spot of horse-riding with a picnic lunch and a dip in the river. Prior experience is not a necessity, however for those feeling nervous there are always bikes to peddle.

VINALES - LAS TERRAZAS Drive to Las Terrazas in the heart of a UNESCO protected area; bask in the tranquility of the undulating hills in every shade of green, groves of palm trees, orchids, hibiscus, steep mountain streams and crystal clear rocky pools. Play I Spy as you spot the many hundreds of birds, butterflies and carefully tended fields of sweet sugar cane. As the afternoon creeps in, those with older children can enjoy an exciting zipline excursion through the forest canopy and across the village of Las Terrazas. There are 6 sections on the biplane course to conquer, which makes this challenge the best of fun. For the less sporty, Las Terrazas is a community eco-project with about 1000 people living there, so is ideal for wandering around – check out the local cafes/bars (children welcome!) which are open all hours. Our favourite is Café de Maria, where you can sample the most delicious locally-grown cuban coffee. For the explorers, travel to the centre of Las Terrazas where you will find an artificial lake, home to spot (non-native) monkeys, flamingoes and many interesting local birds. Hop on a row boat and explore for yourselves. For those looking for an injection of culture, why not seek out the hidden artists’ studios and craft shops stacked high with treasures to take home. There is no “hard sell” in Las Terrazas, one the things which make it such a pleasant place to spend time.
LAS TERRAZAS A full free day to further enjoy Las Terrazas. Why not journey to San Juan waterfalls where you can take a dip in the pools or tip toe your way around the ornate Soroa Orchid Garden.

LAS TERRAZAS - PLAYA LARGA Today is for caffeine lovers. After a traditional breakfast you will visit one of Cuba's very own coffee plantations where you will learn how they take the bean to the cup. The crumbling colonial mansions at the heart of the plantations are very evocative and it is easy to get lost in thoughts of how life might have been a hundred years ago. As the afternoon sun draws in you will drive to Playa Larga. Journey through the back roads of Cuba to get a view of rural life in the city.

PLAYA LARGA - TRINIDAD Continue your tour of Cuba and drive to Trinidad, a journey of around 3 hours. You have the option stop in the attractive town of Cienfuegos en route, which you can discuss with your own personal driver. This is a lovely town situated in an enviable seaside location and is home to a wealth of beautiful old French buildings that were built by the settlers that arrived in the early 19th Century. It is a UNESCO world heritage site and it is easy to see why, with beautiful candy coloured palaces, whitewashed churches, luscious palm trees and a cool sea breeze. We can include a visit to Valle de los Ingenios (Valley of the Sugar Mills), which is 12km from Trinidad. A fascinating place to visit, this is essentially the best preserved living museum of Cuban sugar production of the 18th and 19th century and includes the sites of 75 former cane sugar mills, plantation houses, barracks and other facilities. Sugar production was hugely important for Cuba at that time and many slaves were housed here, even after the abolition of slavery, until the Wars of Independence in the 19th century. This visit also includes seeing the well-maintained Manaca Iznaga (Iznaga Tower), one of the main landmarks of this area.

EL NICHO - TRINIDAD Choose to spend a full free day in Trinidad or adventure into the beautiful Escambray Mountains and Topes de Collante nature reserve by an exciting 4x4 truck ride. Once there, hop into your hiking boots and trek to the El Nicho waterfalls, a turquoise cascade deep in the jungle where you can take a dip. ** Please note, this is not suitable for children of 7 or younger and other groups may join you on this excursion ** As the evening creeps in, make sure to check out the vibrant atmosphere at Casa de la Musica. The town centre is bustling with people learning how to salsa dance, sipping mojitos or simply getting lost in the sweet sounds of the traditional Cuban music.

TRINIDAD You have the chance to take a full day boat trip to Cayo Iguana, an incredible island that is home to a large population of Cuban Iguana. It is also home to the most beautiful beaches and there is fabulous snorkelling off the coast here. Alternatively, we could arrange a day trip to Playa Ancon, here you can enjoy the beach close to Trinidad (about 14km away) without chancing sea legs.

TRINIDAD - SANTA CLARA - CAYO SANTA MARIA Continue your tour of Cuba by heading north to Santa Clara, a vibrant city that sprang to fame when it was liberated by the Argentine guerilla Che Guevara in 1958, marking the end of the Batista regime. Explore the city by foot or visit the Che Guevara Museum, the Mausoleum or ride on the famous armoured train. Later, you will continue to Cayo Santa Maria, where you will part with your driver and enjoy three glorious nights on the sandy shores.
Two full free days to swim, catch or breath or bask in the cuban sun.
CAYO SANTA MARIA - HAVANA Time to say goodbye to Cuba and head home.
